description: From gravity +â€Ž -on. Coined by Russian physicists Dmitrii Blokhintsev and F. M. Gal'perin in 1934, and reintroduced by English physicist Paul Dirac in 1959 in a lecture to the American Physical Society.

entries.meaning: (physics) A hypothetical gauge boson that regulates the gravitational force. It would have a spin of 2 and zero rest mass.
